zone.line:
Last thurday (May 26 28th) I;
my your cousin
my niece and your two brothers went to
walk in Plainpalais. The evening was
warm and serene, and we prolonged our
walk fat farther than usual. It was
ale already dusk before we thought of

returning
When and then we
found discovered ‸ that Ernest
and William who had gone on before,
were not to be found. We accordingly
rested on a seat untill they should
return. Presently Ernest came up &
enquired for his brother he said that
he had been playing with them him
and that William had run away to

hide himself and that he had
wai vainly wai
sought fo for him & afterwards wai
ted a long time but that he did
not return.
This rather alarmed us and we sought
continued to search for himuntill night felll;
Elizabeth conjectured that he might have
returned to the house: but he was
not there â€“ We returned again with torches
for I could not rest when I thought my
sweet child had lost himself, and
was exposed to all the damps & dews
of night; Elizabeth also suffered extreme
anguish. We found him About four
in the morning I discovered my lovely
boy whom the night before I had seen
when
seven
